trans-unit.source: The ISEAddOnTool Object
trans-unit.target: The ISEAddOnTool Object

trans-unit.source: powershell,cmdlet
trans-unit.target: powershell,cmdlet

trans-unit.source: The ISEAddOnTool Object
trans-unit.target: The ISEAddOnTool Object

trans-unit.source: An **ISEAddonTool** object represents an installed add\-on tool that provides additional functionality toWindows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: An **ISEAddonTool** object represents an installed add\-on tool that provides additional functionality toWindows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: An example is the **Commands** tool that you can display by clicking **View**, then **Show Command Add\-on**.
trans-unit.target: An example is the **Commands** tool that you can display by clicking **View**, then **Show Command Add\-on**.

trans-unit.source: This tool is then accessible to you by manipulating the various available **ISEAddOnTool** objects.
trans-unit.target: This tool is then accessible to you by manipulating the various available **ISEAddOnTool** objects.

trans-unit.source: Each add\-on tool can be associated with either the vertical pane or the horizontal pane.
trans-unit.target: Each add\-on tool can be associated with either the vertical pane or the horizontal pane.

trans-unit.source: The vertical pane is docked to the right edge of Windows PowerShell ISE.
trans-unit.target: The vertical pane is docked to the right edge of Windows PowerShell ISE.

trans-unit.source: The horizontal pane is docked to the bottom edge.
trans-unit.target: The horizontal pane is docked to the bottom edge.

trans-unit.source: Each PowerShell tab in Windows PowerShell ISE can have its own set of add\-on tools installed.
trans-unit.target: Each PowerShell tab in Windows PowerShell ISE can have its own set of add\-on tools installed.

trans-unit.source: See [$psISE.CurrentPowerShellTab.HorizontalAddOnTools](The-ISEAddOnToolCollection-Object.md) and [$psISE.CurrentPowerShellTab.VerticalAddOnTools](The-ISEAddOnToolCollection-Object.md) to access the collection of tools available to the currently selected tab or the same properties on any of the **PowerShellTab** objects in the [$psISE.PowerShellTabs](The-PowerShellTabCollection-Object.md) collection object.
trans-unit.target: See [$psISE.CurrentPowerShellTab.HorizontalAddOnTools](The-ISEAddOnToolCollection-Object.md) and [$psISE.CurrentPowerShellTab.VerticalAddOnTools](The-ISEAddOnToolCollection-Object.md) to access the collection of tools available to the currently selected tab or the same properties on any of the **PowerShellTab** objects in the [$psISE.PowerShellTabs](The-PowerShellTabCollection-Object.md) collection object.

trans-unit.source: Methods
trans-unit.target: Methods

trans-unit.source: There are no Windows PowerShell ISE\-specific methods available for objects of this class.
trans-unit.target: There are no Windows PowerShell ISE\-specific methods available for objects of this class.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Control
trans-unit.target: Control

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: The **Control** property provides read access to many of the details of the Commands add\-on tool.
trans-unit.target: The **Control** property provides read access to many of the details of the Commands add\-on tool.

trans-unit.source: IsVisible
trans-unit.target: IsVisible

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: The Boolean property that indicates whether the add\-on tool is currently visible in its assigned pane.
trans-unit.target: The Boolean property that indicates whether the add\-on tool is currently visible in its assigned pane.

trans-unit.source: If it is visible, you can set the **IsVisible** property to **$false** to hide the tool, or set the **IsVisible** property to **$true** to make an add\-on tool visible on its PowerShell tab.
trans-unit.target: If it is visible, you can set the **IsVisible** property to **$false** to hide the tool, or set the **IsVisible** property to **$true** to make an add\-on tool visible on its PowerShell tab.

trans-unit.source: Note that after an add\-on tool is hidden, it is no longer accessible through the **CurrentVisibleHorizontalTool** or **CurrentVisibleVerticalTool** objects, and therefore cannot be made visible by using this property on that object.
trans-unit.target: Note that after an add\-on tool is hidden, it is no longer accessible through the **CurrentVisibleHorizontalTool** or **CurrentVisibleVerticalTool** objects, and therefore cannot be made visible by using this property on that object.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.
trans-unit.target: Supported in Windows PowerShell ISE 3.0 and later, and not present in earlier versions.

trans-unit.source: The read\-only property that gets the name of the add\-on tool.
trans-unit.target: The read\-only property that gets the name of the add\-on tool.
